Thanks a bunch.  Some sort of notification mechanism (or protected 
methods from where we can send notifications) would be of great help.

We were trying to  figure out a way to reduce allreadySeen's  
evergrowing size. And one of the approaches we are trying to explore is 
that when a queue gets exhausted we can delete all the URLs (of the 
exhausted workQueue)  and either add an entry for the  host (effectively 
host/*) or keep a separate exhausted queue.

prasenjit

gojomo@... wrote:

>Look for the call to clearHeld() in WorkQueueFrontier: that's the
>point where the queue is no longer actively 'held' by the other
>queues-of-queues, because it's both empty and and its lingering
>politeness snooze has finished. That's equivalent to the state
>counted by the 'exhausted' statistic.
>
>If this is an important extension point for you, we would consider
>(a patch?) making this step more prominent by factoring it out of
>the overgrown next() method.
>
>Hope this helps,
>
>- Gordon @ IA
>
>Prasenjit Mukherjee wrote:
>  
>
>>Not via UI. I was trying to find out the code section where we could 
>>possibly determine that a particular WorkQueue is exhausted. I looked 
>>into WorkQueuefrontier's activateInactive(),next() and schedule() 
>>methods but couldn't figure it out :(
>>
>>Any kind of pointer  is very much appreciated.
>>
>>thanks,
>>prasen
>>
>>gojomo@... wrote:
>>    
>>
